availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Anderson (Spencer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Vandyke on August 29, 1843. Father of John A. Anderson and Abram Anderson. Married to Mary Elizabeth Bodine. Father of Anne Marie Anderson and William Anderson. Farmer in Spencer County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 111B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 48.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 17.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 1, p. 465C.
George Anderson and Catherine Vandyke, Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Spencer County, August 29, 1843.
Mary Ann Anderson, death certificate, _ Kentucky, Death Records, 1852-1964_, Film 7019152, Spencer County, November 2, 1930 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
William Anderson, death certificate, Death Records, 1852-1964, Film 7019862, Spencer County, May 5, 1936 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
